General aims of &Congruence; package
The &GAP; package &Congruence; ...

Installation and system requirements
&Congruence; does not use external binaries and, therefore, works without restrictions on the type of the operating system. It is designed for &GAP;4.4 and no compatibility with previous releases of &GAP;4 is guaranteed.
To use the &Congruence; online help it is necessary to install the &GAP;4 package &GAPDoc; by Frank L\"ubeck and Max Neunh\"offer, which is available from the &GAP; site or from http://www.math.rwth-aachen.de/˜Frank.Luebeck/GAPDoc/.
&Congruence; is distributed in standard formats (zoo, tar.gz, tar.bz2, -win.zip) and can be obtained from http://www.cs.st-andrews.ac.uk/˜alexk/congruence.htm. To unpack the archive congruence-1.0.zoo you need the program unzoo, which can be obtained from the &GAP; homepage http://www.gap-system.org/ (see section `Distribution'). To install &Congruence;, copy this archive into the pkg subdirectory of your &GAP;4.4 installation. The subdirectory congruence will be created in the pkg directory after the following command:
unzoo -x congruence-1.0.zoo
Installation using other archive formats is performed in a similar way.
